animals.name: African Elephant
animals.description: The African elephant is the largest land animal on Earth. They are highly intelligent and social creatures.
facts: Elephants can live up to 70 years
They communicate through infrasound over long distances
An adult elephant can eat up to 300 pounds of food per day
Elephants are keystone species that shape their environment

animals.name: African Lion
animals.description: The lion is known as the 'King of the Jungle' and is a social big cat living in prides.
animals.diet: Large herbivores like zebras, wildebeest, and buffalo
facts: Lions are the only cats that live in groups called prides
A lion's roar can be heard from 5 miles away
Female lions do most of the hunting
Male lions protect the pride's territory

animals.name: Plains Zebra
animals.description: Zebras are known for their distinctive black and white stripes, which are unique to each individual.
facts: No two zebras have the same stripe pattern
Stripes may help confuse predators
Zebras can run up to 40 mph
They often migrate in large herds

animals.name: Giraffe
animals.description: The giraffe is the tallest land animal, with a long neck that allows it to reach high vegetation.
facts: Giraffes can grow up to 18 feet tall
Their tongues can be up to 20 inches long
They only need to drink water every few days
Giraffes sleep standing up

animals.name: Black Rhinoceros
animals.description: The black rhino is a critically endangered species known for its hooked upper lip.
facts: Black rhinos can weigh up to 3,000 pounds
They have poor eyesight but excellent hearing and smell
Rhinos can run up to 35 mph
Their horns are made of keratin, the same as human hair

animals.name: African Buffalo
animals.description: The African buffalo is a large, powerful herbivore known for its unpredictable nature.
facts: Buffalo are never far from water
They form large herds of up to 1,000 individuals
Buffalo have excellent memory and can hold grudges
They are one of the 'Big Five' game animals

animals.name: African Leopard
animals.description: Leopards are solitary, adaptable big cats known for their spotted coats and tree-climbing ability.
animals.habitat: Various habitats from forests to grasslands
facts: Leopards are excellent climbers and often store prey in trees
They are nocturnal hunters
Leopards can carry prey twice their weight up a tree
They are the most widespread of all big cats
